moves.1. e3 d5 2. c4 Nf6 3. cxd5 Nxd5: Moving twice the knight in the very opening... but after Qxd4, white has an easy developement kicking the queen.
moves.4. Bc4 Bf5: I knew this move would have surprised my opponent...
moves.5. d3: Logical, trying to develop threatening a fork, but...
moves.5... Nb6 6. Bb5+: White is about to lose the d3 pawn... and he has to struggle to save it!
moves.6... c6 7. e4: Bxe4, dxB, QxQ, KxQ, cxB would have been ok for black, I think.
moves.7... cxb5 8. exf5: But I liked to scramble white's game.
moves.10. Nc3: Bb4 could have been an option.
moves.12. Ne4 Bb4+ 13. Bd2 Bxd2+ 14. Kxd2: Interesting, trying to activate the rook soon, but look at this poor isolani... and ah, yes, I have to free my queenside pieces, and take care of Nd6+, royal fork.
moves.14... Qd5 15. Qxd5 Nxd5: Now, I can confidently say that black is better.
moves.16. Nd6+ Ke7 17. Nxb5: White recovers the pawn, but the isolani would be a headache for white.
moves.17... a6 18. Nd4: Nf4 threats g2, but g3 is enough to kick my knight before I can use it against d3.
moves.18... Rd8: A tempo for preparation (now I do threat Nf4, winning a pawn).
moves.20. Rac1: Better to consolidate the d pawn, with Ke2, for Rd8. Maybe.
moves.21. Nc6+ Nxc6 22. Rxc6 Nf4 23. Rc3: g2 is taboo, of course (Rg1, then Rxg7)
moves.23... Rab8 24. b3 e4 25. Nh4: Rd1 would have been better. I would have answered Rb4, and if f3... well, a hell of a thinking :-)
moves.25... Nxd3 26. Nf5+ Kf8 27. Ke3 g6 28. N: If Kxe4, Nxf2+, forking the rook.
